cards.name: Esper Sojourners
cards.text:
When you cycle Esper Sojourners or it dies, you may tap or untap target permanent.
Cycling {2}{U} ({2}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: The wilder the frontier, the greater the need for a controlling hand.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

The triggered ability acts as a cycle-triggered ability or as a leaves-the-battlefield ability, as appropriate. The player who controls the triggered ability is the player who cycled the Sojourner, or the player who last controlled the Sojourner on the battlefield.

If you cycle this card, the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

cards.originalText:
When you cycle Esper Sojourners or it's put into a graveyard from play, you may tap or untap target permanent.
Cycling {2}{U} ({2}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Etherwrought Page
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one —
• You gain 2 life.
• Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.
• Each opponent loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: An unbound page is a riddle, free of cover and of context, a favorite token of the hegemon.

rulings.text: You choose a mode when the ability triggers.
You may choose a different mode each time it triggers.

foreignNames.name: エーテル鋳込みの紙片

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one — You gain 2 life; or look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card into your graveyard; or each opponent loses 1 life.

cards.name: Sen Triplets
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, choose target opponent. This turn, that player can't cast spells or activate abilities and plays with their hand revealed. You may play cards from that player's hand this turn.
cards.flavor: They are the masters of your mind.

rulings.text: Playing a card this way works just like playing any other card, with one exception: You're playing the card from your opponent's hand rather than your own. To be specific: -- A card played this way follows the normal timing rules for its card type, as well as any other applicable restrictions such as "Cast [this card] only during combat." For example, you can't play a card from the targeted opponent's hand during your end step unless it's an instant or has flash. -- To cast a nonland card from your opponent's hand this way, you must pay its mana cost. -- You can play a land card from the targeted opponent's hand only if you haven't played a land yet that turn.

You control the spells you cast from your opponent's hand, so you make decisions for them as appropriate. For example, if one of those spells says "target creature you control," you'll target one of your creatures, not one of your opponent's creatures.
If you cast a spell with cascade this way, you'll control the cascade ability. When it resolves, you'll find a new card to cast from your own library.
You can cast spells from the targeted player's hand, but you can't activate abilities. Specifically, you can't cycle cards in that player's hand.

This ability doesn't prevent the targeted opponent's triggered abilities from triggering. If one does, that player puts it on the stack and, if applicable, chooses targets for it. Those abilities will resolve as normal.
If the resolution of a spell or ability involves having the targeted player cast a spell, that part of the effect simply won't work.

After this ability resolves, the targeted player still gets priority at the appropriate times, and can still perform special actions (such as turning a face-down creature face up). However, since that player can't cast any spells or activate abilities — including mana abilities — there's not much they can actually accomplish this way.

If you start to play a card from the targeted opponent's hand, there's no way for the opponent to get rid of that card in response (like discarding it to pay Gathan Raiders's morph cost, for example). That's because the first thing that happens when you start to cast a spell is that it moves to the stack, so it's not in your opponent's hand anymore.
Once Sen Triplets's ability resolves, it remains in effect for the rest of the turn whether or not you still control Sen Triplets.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, choose target opponent. This turn, that player can't play spells or activated abilities and plays with his or her hand revealed. You can play cards from that player's hand this turn.

cards.name: Sphinx of the Steel Wind
cards.text: Flying, first strike, vigilance, lifelink, protection from red and from green
cards.flavor: No one has properly answered her favorite riddle: "Why should I spare your life?"

foreignNames.name: 鋼の風のスフィンクス

cards.originalText: Flying, first strike, vigilance, lifelink, protection from red and from green

cards.name: Drastic Revelation
cards.text: Discard your hand. Draw seven cards, then discard three cards at random.
cards.flavor: Every disaster holds mystery, for lack of a sane witness.

rulings.text: You discard your hand as part of Drastic Revelation's effect, not as an additional cost. If you have no cards in hand at this point, you simply don't discard any; the rest of the spell will still have its effect.
You'll discard three cards at random even if some other effect replaces your seven draws.
If there are fewer than seven cards left in your library, you'll draw all the cards in your library, then you'll discard three cards at random. Then you'll lose the game as a state-based action.

cards.originalText: Discard your hand. Draw seven cards, then discard three cards at random.

cards.name: Grixis Sojourners
cards.text:
When you cycle Grixis Sojourners or it dies, you may exile target card from a graveyard.
Cycling {2}{B} ({2}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

The triggered ability acts as a cycle-triggered ability or as a leaves-the-battlefield ability, as appropriate. The player who controls the triggered ability is the player who cycled the Sojourner, or the player who last controlled the Sojourner on the battlefield.

If you cycle this card, the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.
Grixis Sojourner's triggered ability may target Grixis Sojourners itself. By the time the ability triggers, Grixis Sojourner will already be in your graveyard.

cards.originalText:
When you cycle Grixis Sojourners or it's put into a graveyard from play, you may remove target card in a graveyard from the game.
Cycling {2}{B} ({2}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Thraximundar
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Thraximundar attacks, defending player sacrifices a creature.
Whenever a player sacrifices a creature, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Thraximundar.
cards.flavor: His name means "he who paints the earth red."

rulings.text: Thraximundar's middle ability resolves during the declare attackers step. The defending player sacrifices a creature before it would get a chance to block.

Thraximundar's last ability triggers whenever any player (including you) sacrifices a creature for any reason. It doesn't trigger only when a creature is sacrificed due to its middle ability. Note that Thraximundar itself doesn't allow you to sacrifice any creatures.

cards.originalText:
Haste
Whenever Thraximundar attacks, defending player sacrifices a creature.
Whenever a player sacrifices a creature, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Thraximundar.

cards.name: Unscythe, Killer of Kings

rulings.text: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether that creature had been dealt damage this turn by the creature that Unscythe is currently attached to. If so, Unscythe's second ability will trigger. This is true even if Unscythe wasn't attached to the creature at the time it dealt that damage. Only the currently equipped creature is checked, not any creatures that Unscythe may have been attached to earlier in the turn.
Unscythe's second ability cares about any damage, not just combat damage.

If Unscythe's second ability triggers, but the creature that was put into a graveyard is somehow removed from the graveyard in response (or it was a token), it won't be able to be exiled with Unscythe's ability. You won't get a Zombie token.

foreignNames.name: 王を葬る鎌、アンサイズ

cards.name: Dragon Appeasement
cards.text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you sacrifice a creature, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Look there—they carry that one upon a sedan chair. It must be their leader. Wait . . . Oh! Perhaps not."
—Kaeda, aven scout

rulings.text: Dragon Appeasement itself doesn't allow you to sacrifice any creatures. Its last ability triggers whenever you sacrifice a creature because some other spell, ability, or cost instructed you to.

cards.originalText:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you sacrifice a creature, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Jund Sojourners
cards.text:
When you cycle Jund Sojourners or it dies, you may have it deal 1 damage to any target.
Cycling {2}{R} ({2}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

The triggered ability acts as a cycle-triggered ability or as a leaves-the-battlefield ability, as appropriate. The player who controls the triggered ability is the player who cycled the Sojourner, or the player who last controlled the Sojourner on the battlefield.

If you cycle this card, the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

cards.originalText:
When you cycle Jund Sojourners or it's put into a graveyard from play, you may have it deal 1 damage to target creature or player.
Cycling {2}{R} ({2}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund
cards.text:
Flying, haste
When Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund enters the battlefield, gain control of all Dragons, then untap all Dragons.
Other Dragon creatures you control have haste.

rulings.text: The triggered ability's control-change effect has no duration. Each Dragon you gain control of this way will remain under your control until the game ends, that permanent leaves the battlefield, or some other effect changes its controller.

When the triggered ability resolves, you'll gain control of all Dragons, including the Dragons you already control (such as Karrthus itself). Usually this will have no appreciable effect, though it will override any previous control-change abilities (such as if you had gained control of one of those Dragons only for the rest of the turn). Then you'll untap all Dragons, including the ones you already controlled and Karrthus itself (if it had somehow managed to become tapped by then).

foreignNames.name: ジャンドの暴君、カーサス

cards.originalText:
Flying, haste
When Karrthus, Tyrant of Jund comes into play, gain control of all Dragons, then untap all Dragons.
Other Dragon creatures you control have haste.

cards.name: Lavalanche
cards.text: Lavalanche deals X damage to target player or planeswalker and each creature that player or that planeswalker's controller controls.
cards.flavor: Alara's burning blood cannot be contained by mere earth and stone.

rulings.text: If the targeted player has become an illegal target by the time Lavalanche resolves, Lavalanche doesn't resolve. Nothing will be dealt damage.

Because Lavalanche doesn't target any creatures, it will deal damage to creatures with shroud. Any damage it would deal to creatures with appropriate protection abilities will still be prevented, however.

cards.originalText: Lavalanche deals X damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.

cards.name: Madrush Cyclops
cards.text: Creatures you control have haste.
cards.flavor: Death comes in the blink of an eye.

rulings.text: Madrush Cyclops gives itself haste.

foreignNames.name: 無謀突進のサイクロプス

cards.originalText: Creatures you control have haste.

cards.name: Gloryscale Viashino
cards.text: Whenever you cast a multicolored spell, Gloryscale Viashino gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"This is a new world and a new war. We need warriors who know chaos and how to combat it."
—Lisha of the Azure

foreignNames.name: 栄光鱗のヴィーアシーノ
Viashino à la peau de gloire

cards.originalText: Whenever you play a multicolored spell, Gloryscale Viashino gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Mayael's Aria
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control if you control a creature with power 5 or greater. Then you gain 10 life if you control a creature with power 10 or greater. Then you win the game if you control a creature with power 20 or greater.

rulings.text: This ability triggers at the beginning of each of your upkeeps. Whether you control any applicable creatures is checked only when the ability resolves.

The three parts of the ability happen sequentially. For example, if you control a creature with 9 power when the ability starts to resolve, you'll put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control — and now, since you control a creature with 10 power, you'll gain 10 life.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control if you control a creature with power 5 or greater. Then you gain 10 life if you control a creature with power 10 or greater. Then you win the game if you control a creature with power 20 or greater.

cards.name: Naya Sojourners
cards.text:
When you cycle Naya Sojourners or it dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: The elves had entered a land like an open grave—an act of fortitude or folly?

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

The triggered ability acts as a cycle-triggered ability or as a leaves-the-battlefield ability, as appropriate. The player who controls the triggered ability is the player who cycled the Sojourner, or the player who last controlled the Sojourner on the battlefield.

If you cycle this card, the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

cards.originalText:
When you cycle Naya Sojourners or it's put into a graveyard from play, you may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Retaliator Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage to you, you may put that many +1/+1 counters on Retaliator Griffin.
cards.flavor: For every eye, an eye. For every tooth, a tooth. Griffins are nothing if not fair.

rulings.text: The source of combat damage is the creature that dealt it.

If a spell causes damage to be dealt, that spell will always identify the source of the damage. In most cases, the source is the spell itself. For example, Breath of Malfegor says "Breath of Malfegor deals 5 damage to each opponent."

If an ability causes damage to be dealt, that ability will always identify the source of the damage. The ability itself is never the source. However, the source of the ability is often the source of the damage. For example, Deathbringer Thoctar's ability says "Deathbringer Thoctar deals 1 damage to any target."

If the source of the damage is a permanent, Retaliator Griffin checks whether an opponent controls that permanent at the time that damage is dealt. If the permanent has left the battlefield by then, its last known information is used. If the source of the damage is a spell, whether it's controlled by an opponent is obvious. If the source of the damage is a card in some other zone (such as a cycled Jund Sojourners), Retaliator Griffin checks whether the card's owner, rather than its controller, is an opponent.

If Retaliator Griffin is dealt lethal damage at the same time that you're dealt damage by a source an opponent controls, Retaliator Griffin will be put into a graveyard before it would receive any counters. Its ability will still trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever a source an opponent controls deals damage to you, you may put that many +1/+1 counters on Retaliator Griffin.

cards.name: Uril, the Miststalker
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Uril, the Miststalker gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.
cards.flavor: It strides through the whitecover, mists in which even gargantuans can hide.
cards.originalText:
Uril, the Miststalker can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control. 
Uril gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.

cards.name: Bant Sojourners
cards.text:
When you cycle Bant Sojourners or it dies, you may create a 1/1 white Soldier creature token.
Cycling {2}{W} ({2}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: "We must spread Bant's light before we are shadowed over."

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

The triggered ability acts as a cycle-triggered ability or as a leaves-the-battlefield ability, as appropriate. The player who controls the triggered ability is the player who cycled the Sojourner, or the player who last controlled the Sojourner on the battlefield.

If you cycle this card, the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.

cards.originalText:
When you cycle Bant Sojourners or it's put into a graveyard from play, you may put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token into play.
Cycling {2}{W} ({2}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Finest Hour
cards.text:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, if it's the first combat phase of the turn, untap that creature. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

rulings.text: Finest Hour's second ability has an "intervening 'if' clause." The ability won't trigger at all unless it's the first combat phase of the turn.
Unlike other similar cards, Finest Hour doesn't create a main phase in between the two combat phases. The second combat phase will begin immediately after the current one ends.

cards.originalText:
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, if it's the first combat phase of the turn, untap that creature. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

cards.name: Flurry of Wings
cards.text: Create X 1/1 white Bird Soldier creature tokens with flying, where X is the number of attacking creatures.
cards.flavor: "We are born soldiers. The call to battle is a homecoming."

rulings.text: An "attacking creature" is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.

Flurry of Wings counts the number of creatures that are attacking as it resolves. It doesn't matter how many creatures were originally declared as attackers that turn. It also doesn't matter who controls those creatures, or who or what they're attacking.
If Flurry of Wings is cast before attackers have been declared or after combat ends, it won't do anything.

cards.originalText: Put X 1/1 white Bird Soldier creature tokens with flying into play, where X is the number of attacking creatures.

cards.name: Jenara, Asura of War
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Jenara, Asura of War.
cards.flavor: Wounded soldiers looked up, grateful for her appearance. But she passed over them, her eyes firmly on their foe.

foreignNames.name: 戦争のアスラ、ジェナーラ

cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{W}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Jenara, Asura of War.

cards.name: Wargate
cards.text: Search your library for a permanent card with converted mana cost X or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Bant mages still call to the heavens for aid, but angels are not the only ones who answer.

rulings.text: A permanent card is an artifact, creature, enchantment, land, or planeswalker card.

You may always find a permanent card with converted mana cost 0. (If X is 0, that's all you can find.) Cards with no mana cost (such as land cards), cards with mana cost {0}, and cards with mana cost {X} all have converted mana cost 0.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a permanent card with converted mana cost X or less, put it into play, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Maelstrom Nexus
cards.text: The first spell you cast each turn has cascade. (When you cast your first spell, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card that costs less. You may cast it without paying its mana cost. Put the exiled cards on the bottom of your library in a random order.)

rulings.text: Cascade triggers when you cast the spell, meaning that it resolves before that spell. If you end up casting the exiled card, it will go on the stack above the spell with cascade.
When the cascade ability resolves, you must exile cards. The only optional part of the ability is whether or not you cast the last card exiled.
If a spell with cascade is countered, the cascade ability will still resolve normally.
You exile the cards face-up. All players will be able to see them.

If you cast the last exiled card, you're casting it as a spell. It can be countered. If that card has cascade, the new spell's cascade ability will trigger, and you'll repeat the process for the new spell.

After you're done exiling cards and casting the last one if you chose to do so, the remaining exiled cards are randomly placed on the bottom of your library. Neither you nor any other player is allowed to know the order of those cards.
Maelstrom Nexus affects the first spell you cast each turn, not just the first spell you cast on your own turn.

If the first spell you cast in a turn already has cascade, both cascade abilities will trigger separately. Deal with them one at a time: First one cascade ability will resolve, and you'll cast the applicable card if you want. That new spell will resolve. Then the other cascade ability will resolve in the same way. Finally, the original spell will resolve.

This effect takes into account spells that were cast earlier in the turn that Maelstrom Nexus entered the battlefield, including any spells still on the stack. If you've already cast any spells that turn (including Maelstrom Nexus itself), this ability won't give any of your spells cascade that turn.

A spell's converted mana cost is determined solely by the mana symbols printed in its upper right corner. If its mana cost includes {X}, take the chosen value of X into account. Ignore any alternative costs, additional costs, cost increases, or cost reductions.
The converted mana cost of a split card is determined by the combined mana cost of its two halves. If cascade allows you to cast a split card, you may cast either half but not both halves.

cards.originalText: The first spell you play each turn has cascade. (When you play your first spell, remove cards from the top of your library from the game until you remove a nonland card that costs less. You may play it without paying its mana cost. Put the removed cards on the bottom in a random order.)

cards.name: Arsenal Thresher
cards.text: As Arsenal Thresher enters the battlefield, you may reveal any number of other artifact cards from your hand. Arsenal Thresher enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each card revealed this way.

rulings.text: If multiple Arsenal Threshers are entering the battlefield at the same time (for example, if Warp World is resolving), you may reveal the same artifact cards from your hand for each of them.

If Arsenal Thresher and another artifact are entering the battlefield from your hand at the same time, you may reveal that other artifact for Arsenal Thresher. If that artifact is a second Arsenal Thresher, you may reveal each Arsenal Thresher for the other.

cards.originalText: As Arsenal Thresher comes into play, you may reveal any number of other artifact cards from your hand. Arsenal Thresher comes into play with a +1/+1 counter on it for each card revealed this way.

cards.name: Esper Stormblade
cards.text: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Esper Stormblade gets +1/+1 and has flying.
cards.flavor: Stormcallers came to appreciate the novelty of Jund's volcanic updrafts.
cards.originalText: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Esper Stormblade gets +1/+1 and has flying.

cards.name: Thopter Foundry
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a nontoken artifact: Create a 1/1 blue Thopter artifact creature token with flying. You gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Etherium is limited. Innovation is not."
—Tezzeret

rulings.text: The nontoken artifact you sacrifice may be Thopter Foundry itself.

cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice a nontoken artifact: Put a 1/1 blue Thopter artifact creature token with flying into play. You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Grixis Grimblade
cards.text: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Grixis Grimblade gets +1/+1 and has deathtouch. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)
cards.originalText: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Grixis Grimblade gets +1/+1 and has deathtouch. (Whenever it deals damage to a creature, destroy that creature.)

cards.name: Sewn-Eye Drake
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.flavor:
"Too wary to charge, too prudent to serve. Not anymore."
—Sedris, the Traitor King
cards.originalText: Flying, haste

cards.name: Slave of Bolas
cards.text: Gain control of target creature. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: Nicol Bolas doesn't distinguish between servants and victims.

rulings.text: You may target a creature you already control.

If you don't control the targeted creature when the "at end of turn" ability resolves, it won't be sacrificed. If it's still on the battlefield but under another player's control, the ability won't try to have you sacrifice it again at the end of the turn after that.

cards.originalText: Gain control of target creature. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. Sacrifice it at end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Ambush Beetle
cards.text:
Haste
When Giant Ambush Beetle enters the battlefield, you may have target creature block it this turn if able.
cards.flavor: It waits with absolute stillness. One might think it a statue if it weren't occasionally seen chewing on its victims.

rulings.text: You decide whether to have the targeted creature block Giant Ambush Beetle this turn if able at the time the enters-the-battlefield ability resolves, not at the time Giant Ambush Beetle attacks.

Deciding to have the targeted creature block doesn't force you to attack with Giant Ambush Beetle that turn. If Giant Ambush Beetle doesn't attack, the targeted creature is free to block whichever creature its controller chooses, or block no creatures at all.

If you choose to have the targeted creature block but that creature isn't able to block Giant Ambush Beetle (for example, because the targeted creature can block only creatures with flying), the requirement to block does nothing. The targeted creature is free to block whichever creature its controller chooses, or block no creatures at all.

Tapped creatures, creatures that can't block as the result of an effect, creatures with unpaid costs to block (such as those from War Cadence), and creatures that aren't controlled by the defending player are exempt from effects that would require them to block. Such creatures can be targeted by Giant Ambush Beetle's ability, but the requirement to block does nothing.

cards.originalText:
Haste
When Giant Ambush Beetle comes into play, you may have target creature block it this turn if able.

cards.name: Jund Hackblade
cards.text: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Jund Hackblade gets +1/+1 and has haste.
cards.flavor: The knights were halfway through their precombat rites before they realized the foul brute meant to start without them.
cards.originalText: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Jund Hackblade gets +1/+1 and has haste.

cards.name: Sangrite Backlash
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/-3.
cards.flavor:
"Sangrite is the dragon's beating heart. Little wonder, then, that so many fools' chests burst trying to contain it."
—Sarkhan Vol
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/-3.

cards.name: Marisi's Twinclaws
cards.text: Double strike
cards.flavor:
"Looks like we're completely outnumbered."
"Lucky for us. I thought we'd be bored."
cards.originalText: Double strike

cards.name: Naya Hushblade
cards.text: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Naya Hushblade gets +1/+1 and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.originalText: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Naya Hushblade gets +1/+1 and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Trace of Abundance
cards.text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional one mana of any color.
cards.originalText:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

cards.name: Bant Sureblade
cards.text: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Bant Sureblade gets +1/+1 and has first strike.
cards.flavor: Soldiers who fought through Grixis learned to hit first, recite the prayer of Asha later.
cards.originalText: As long as you control another multicolored permanent, Bant Sureblade gets +1/+1 and has first strike.

cards.name: Crystallization
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, exile that creature.

rulings.text: When the enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, Crystallization's last ability will trigger. When that ability resolves, that creature will be exiled, even if Crystallization has left the battlefield or is enchanting a different creature by that time. If Crystallization is still enchanting the same creature, Crystallization will then be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, remove that creature from the game.

cards.name: Messenger Falcons
cards.text:
Flying
When Messenger Falcons enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: So many aven had died scouting the distant fronts that the knight-captains recruited Nayan falcons as couriers.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Messenger Falcons comes into play, draw a card.

cards.name: Angelfire Crusader
cards.text: {R}: Angelfire Crusader gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Nothing burns hotter than the fires of holy rage.
cards.originalText: {R}: Angelfire Crusader gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Coalition Flag
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
Enchanted creature is a Flagbearer.
While choosing targets as part of casting a spell or activating an ability, your opponents must choose at least one Flagbearer on the battlefield if able.

rulings.text: If this card is ever on a creature you don't control, it is put into the graveyard as a State-Based Action.

cards.originalText:
Coalition Flag can enchant only a creature you control.
Enchanted creature's type is Flagbearer.
If an opponent plays a spell or ability that could target a Flagbearer in play, that player chooses at least one Flagbearer as a target.

cards.name: Coalition Honor Guard
cards.text: While choosing targets as part of casting a spell or activating an ability, your opponents must choose at least one Flagbearer on the battlefield if able.
cards.flavor: Giving little thought to their own defense, they carried the flag that united their army.

rulings.text: Any player's Flagbearer may be targeted. For example, if each player controls a Coalition Honor Guard, Seal of Strength's ability may target any of them.

Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text. Triggered abilities (written with "when," "whenever," or "at") don't have to target a Flagbearer.
If a spell or ability's targets are changed, or if a copy of a spell or ability is put onto the stack and has new targets chosen, it doesn't have to target a Flagbearer.

cards.originalText: If an opponent plays a spell or ability that could target a Flagbearer in play, that player chooses at least one Flagbearer as a target.

cards.name: Dega Disciple
cards.text:
{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
{R}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "There is no true equity of power. There is only more and less."
cards.originalText:
{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
{R}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Dega Sanctuary
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a black or red permanent, you gain 2 life. If you control a black permanent and a red permanent, you gain 4 life instead.

rulings.text: You can gain 2 or 4 life, but never 6.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a black or red permanent, you gain 2 life. If you control a black permanent and a red permanent, you gain 4 life instead.

cards.name: Degavolver
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{B} and/or {R} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} and/or {R} as you cast this spell.)
If Degavolver was kicked with its {1}{B} kicker, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with "Pay 3 life: Regenerate Degavolver."
If Degavolver was kicked with its {R} kicker, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it and with first strike.

cards.name: Diversionary Tactics
cards.text: Tap two untapped creatures you control: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor: "It's the oldest trick in the book," said Guff. "And I ought to know—I wrote it."
cards.originalText: Tap two untapped creatures you control: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Divine Light
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn to creatures you control.
cards.flavor:
"Phyrexia is an unforgiving place, and I am an angry lord in an unforgiving mood."
—Lord Windgrace
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt this turn to creatures you control.

cards.name: Enlistment Officer
cards.text:
First strike
When Enlistment Officer enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Soldier cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.originalText:
First strike
When Enlistment Officer comes into play, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Soldier cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: False Dawn
cards.text:
Until end of turn, spells and abilities you control that would add colored mana instead add that much white mana. Until end of turn, you may spend white mana as though it were mana of any color.
Draw a card.

rulings.text: This card's ability does not change the color of any permanents.
This card's ability does not change any lands into Plains.

cards.originalText:
Colored mana symbols on all permanents you control and on all cards you own that aren't in play become {W} until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Gerrard Capashen
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 1 life for each card in target opponent's hand.
{3}{W}: Tap target creature. Activate this ability only if Gerrard Capashen is attacking.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 1 life for each card in target opponent's hand.
{3}{W}: Tap target creature. Play this ability only if Gerrard Capashen is attacking.

cards.name: Haunted Angel
cards.text:
Flying
When Haunted Angel dies, exile Haunted Angel and each other player creates a 3/3 black Angel creature token with flying.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Haunted Angel is put into a graveyard from play, remove Haunted Angel from the game and each other player puts a 3/3 black Angel creature token with flying into play.

cards.name: Helionaut
cards.text:
Flying
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: Hope kept the defenders aloft, but only courage kept them in the fight.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Manacles of Decay
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack.
{B}: Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
{R}: Enchanted creature can't block this turn.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature can't attack.
{B}: Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
{R}: Enchanted creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Orim's Thunder
cards.text:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If this spell was kicked, it deals damage equal to that permanent's converted mana cost to target creature.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you play this spell.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment. If you paid the kicker cost, Orim's Thunder deals damage equal to that artifact or enchantment's converted mana cost to target creature.

cards.name: Shield of Duty and Reason
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from green and from blue.
cards.flavor: The duty: to defend. The reason: to survive.

foreignNames.name: Bouclier du devoir et de la raison
Scudo del Dovere e della Ragione

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature has protection from green and from blue.

cards.name: Spectral Lynx
cards.text:
Protection from green
{B}: Regenerate Spectral Lynx.
cards.flavor: A shadowy version of its corporeal cousin, this lynx hunts souls, not meals.
cards.originalText:
Protection from green
{B}: Regenerate Spectral Lynx.

cards.name: Standard Bearer
cards.text: While choosing targets as part of casting a spell or activating an ability, your opponents must choose at least one Flagbearer on the battlefield if able.
cards.flavor: The standard was a rallying point for the army and a target for the enemy.
cards.originalText: If an opponent plays a spell or ability that could target a Flagbearer in play, that player chooses at least one Flagbearer as a target.

cards.name: Ceta Disciple
cards.text:
{R}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
{G}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: "The sea holds all that you need. You simply must know how to ask for it."
cards.originalText:
{R}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
{G}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Ceta Sanctuary
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a red or green permanent, draw a card, then discard a card. If you control a red permanent and a green permanent, instead draw two cards, then discard a card.

rulings.text: The ability has you draw one or two cards, but never three.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a red or green permanent, draw a card, then discard a card from your hand. If you control a red permanent and a green permanent, instead draw two cards, then discard a card from your hand.

cards.name: Cetavolver
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{R} and/or {G} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} and/or {G} as you cast this spell.)
If Cetavolver was kicked with its {1}{R} kicker, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with first strike.
If Cetavolver was kicked with its {G} kicker, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it and with trample.

cards.name: Coastal Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{U}, {T}: Return target Kavu to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: When the kavu emerged from their ancient nests, food chains long dormant became vibrant again.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{U}, {T}: Return target Kavu to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Evasive Action
cards.text: Domain — Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each basic land type among lands you control.
cards.flavor: Effective use of terrain is a lesson good commanders learn quickly.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each basic land type among lands you control.

cards.name: Ice Cave
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, any other player may pay that spell's mana cost. If a player does, counter the spell. (Mana cost includes color.)
cards.flavor: Even the oppresive cold of the cave could not temper Eladamri's ire.

rulings.text: The mana cost does not include cost increases or reductions.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a spell, any other player may pay that spell's mana cost. If a player does, counter the spell. (Mana cost includes color.)

cards.name: Index
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor: "Let's see . . . Mercadia, mercenary, merfolk . . . you know, I really need a better filing system."
cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Jaded Response
cards.text: Counter target spell if it shares a color with a creature you control.
cards.flavor:
"Calm down everyone; it's nothing we haven't seen before."
—Sisay

rulings.text: It does not check colors until it resolves.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell if it shares a color with a creature you control.

cards.name: Jilt
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} as you cast this spell.)
Return target creature to its owner's hand. If this spell was kicked, it deals 2 damage to another target creature.
cards.flavor:
"You're not my Hanna"
—Gerrard, to Yawgmoth
cards.originalText:
Kicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} as you play this spell.)
Return target creature to its owner's hand. If you paid the kicker cost, Jilt deals 2 damage to another target creature.

cards.name: Living Airship
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{G}: Regenerate Living Airship.
cards.flavor: The ship has a crew of three: the pilot, the gunner, and the ship itself.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}{G}: Regenerate Living Airship.

cards.name: Reef Shaman
cards.text: {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: With one gesture, she can render a thousand years of navigational charts obsolete.
cards.originalText: {T}: Target land's type becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Shimmering Mirage
cards.text:
Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Oh, is that all you need? Why didn't you just say so?"
—Reef shaman
cards.originalText:
Target land's type becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Tidal Courier
cards.text:
When Tidal Courier enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Merfolk cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
{3}{U}: Tidal Courier gains flying until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
When Tidal Courier comes into play, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Merfolk cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library.
{3}{U}: Tidal Courier gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Unnatural Selection
cards.text: {1}: Choose a creature type other than Wall. Target creature becomes that type until end of turn.
cards.flavor: What nature makes, magic can modify.

rulings.text: You must choose a creature type that already exists in Magic.

cards.originalText: {1}: Choose a creature type other than Wall. Target creature's type becomes that type until end of turn.

cards.name: Vodalian Mystic
cards.text: {T}: Target instant or sorcery spell becomes the color of your choice.
cards.flavor:
"Sometimes when I look at the ocean, I could swear it changes colors."
—Sisay

rulings.text: It can target spells of type instant or sorcery, and not spells of other types that say they can be cast "any time you could cast" an instant or sorcery.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target instant or sorcery spell becomes the color of your choice.

cards.name: Whirlpool Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Whirlpool Drake enters the battlefield, shuffle the cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.
When Whirlpool Drake dies, shuffle the cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Whirlpool Drake comes into play, shuffle the cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.
When Whirlpool Drake is put into a graveyard from play, shuffle the cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.

cards.name: Whirlpool Rider
cards.text: When Whirlpool Rider enters the battlefield, shuffle the cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.
cards.flavor: Where the wind meets the water, change is inevitable.
cards.originalText: When Whirlpool Rider comes into play, shuffle the cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.

cards.name: Whirlpool Warrior
cards.text:
When Whirlpool Warrior enters the battlefield, shuffle the cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.
{R}, Sacrifice Whirlpool Warrior: Each player shuffles the cards from their hand into their library, then draws that many cards.
cards.originalText:
When Whirlpool Warrior comes into play, shuffle the cards from your hand into your library, then draw that many cards.
{R}, Sacrifice Whirlpool Warrior: Each player shuffles the cards from his or her hand into his or her library, then draws that many cards.

cards.name: Dead Ringers
cards.text: Destroy two target nonblack creatures unless either one is a color the other isn't. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: "Beautiful, isn't it?" crowed Crovax. "They fought together. Now they will die together."

rulings.text: Both of the target creatures must be exactly the same color or combination of colors. Both being colorless is also okay. If they differ in any way, you can still cast the spell, but it does not do anything on resolution.
Colors are checked on resolution.

cards.originalText: Destroy two target nonblack creatures unless either one is a color the other isn't. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Desolation Angel
cards.text:
Kicker {W}{W} (You may pay an additional {W}{W} as you cast this spell.)
Flying
When Desolation Angel enters the battlefield, destroy all lands you control. If it was kicked, destroy all lands instead.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {W}{W} (You may pay an additional {W}{W} as you play this spell.)
Flying
When Desolation Angel comes into play, destroy all lands you control. If you paid the kicker cost, destroy all lands instead.

cards.name: Foul Presence
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and has "{T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn."
cards.flavor: The Phyrexians have one word that means both "evolution" and "pain."
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and has "{T}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn."

cards.name: Grave Defiler
cards.text:
When Grave Defiler enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Zombie cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Grave Defiler.
cards.originalText:
When Grave Defiler comes into play, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Zombie cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Grave Defiler.

cards.name: Last Caress
cards.text:
Target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
Draw a card.
cards.originalText:
Target player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Mind Extraction
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Target player reveals their hand and discards all cards of each of the sacrificed creature's colors.

rulings.text: If you sacrifice a colorless creature, you get to see their hand but they discard no cards.
If you sacrifice a multicolored creature, all cards that share at least one color with the creature are discarded.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Mind Extraction, sacrifice a creature.
Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of each of the sacrificed creature's colors from it.

cards.name: Mournful Zombie
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Target player gains 1 life.
cards.flavor: Treated with a powerful mix of herbs and potions, its wrappings have a remarkable preservative effect, even for the living.
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Target player gains 1 life.

cards.name: Necra Disciple
cards.text:
{G}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.
{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: "The darkness merely hides the light."
cards.originalText:
{G}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Necra Sanctuary
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a green or white permanent, target player loses 1 life. If you control a green permanent and a white permanent, that player loses 3 life instead.

rulings.text: It can make a player lose 0, 1, or 3 life, but never 4.
One permanent that is both white and green will cause the player to be affected by the lose 3 life portion.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a green or white permanent, target player loses 1 life. If you control a green permanent and a white permanent, that player loses 3 life instead.

cards.name: Necravolver
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{G} and/or {W} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} and/or {W} as you cast this spell.)
If Necravolver was kicked with its {1}{G} kicker, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with trample.
If Necravolver was kicked with its {W} kicker, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it and with "Whenever Necravolver deals damage, you gain that much life."

cards.name: Phyrexian Arena
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: An audience of one with the malice of thousands.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Phyrexian Gargantua
cards.text: When Phyrexian Gargantua enters the battlefield, you draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: Other Phyrexians have nightmares about the gargantua.
cards.originalText: When Phyrexian Gargantua comes into play, you draw two cards and you lose 2 life.

cards.name: Phyrexian Rager
cards.text: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: It takes no prisoners, but it keeps the choicest bits for Phyrexia.
cards.originalText: When Phyrexian Rager comes into play, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Planar Despair
cards.text: Domain — All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.
cards.flavor: All of Dominaria recoiled as Yawgmoth and his retainers arrived.

rulings.text: To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.

A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control — they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

cards.originalText: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.

cards.name: Quagmire Druid
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target enchantment.
cards.flavor: As the druids had devoted their lives to preserving Dominaria, so did they devote their deaths.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Suppress
cards.text: Target player exiles all cards from their hand face down. At the beginning of the end step of that player's next turn, that player returns those cards to their hand.
cards.originalText: Target player removes all cards in his or her hand from the game face down. At the end of that player's next turn, that player returns those cards to his or her hand.

cards.name: Urborg Uprising
cards.text:
Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: In Urborg, few things are less permanent than death.

rulings.text: You can cast Urborg Uprising with zero targets if you only want to draw a card.
If you chose at least one target and all targets are illegal on resolution, you won't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Zombie Boa
cards.text: {1}{B}: Choose a color. Whenever Zombie Boa becomes blocked by a creature of that color this turn, destroy that creature. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: It doesn't need to feed, but still it hungers.
cards.originalText: {1}{B}: Choose a color. Whenever Zombie Boa becomes blocked by a creature of that color this turn, destroy that creature. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.flavor: It took all its strength to contain the fire within.
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Colossus: Bloodfire Colossus deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Bloodfire Dwarf
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Dwarf: Bloodfire Dwarf deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor: For them, the only honorable death is one that leaves a crater.
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Dwarf: Bloodfire Dwarf deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Bloodfire Infusion
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
{R}, Sacrifice enchanted creature: Bloodfire Infusion deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to each creature.

rulings.text: If this card is ever on a creature you don't control, it is put into the graveyard as a State-Based Action.

cards.originalText:
Bloodfire Infusion can enchant only a creature you control.
{R}, Sacrifice enchanted creature: Bloodfire Infusion deals damage equal to the enchanted creature's power to each creature.

cards.name: Bloodfire Kavu
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Kavu: Bloodfire Kavu deals 2 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor: Heart of fire, blood of lava, teeth of stone.
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Kavu: Bloodfire Kavu deals 2 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Desolation Giant
cards.text:
Kicker {W}{W} (You may pay an additional {W}{W} as you cast this spell.)
When Desolation Giant enters the battlefield, destroy all other creatures you control. If it was kicked, destroy all other creatures instead.
cards.originalText:
Kicker {W}{W} (You may pay an additional {W}{W} as you play this spell.)
When Desolation Giant comes into play, destroy all other creatures you control. If you paid the kicker cost, destroy all other creatures instead.

cards.name: Dwarven Landslide
cards.text:
Kicker—{2}{R}, Sacrifice a land. (You may pay {2}{R} and sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target land. If this spell was kicked, destroy another target land.
cards.originalText:
Kicker—{2}{R}, Sacrifice a land. (You may pay {2}{R} and sacrifice a land in addition to any other costs as you play this spell.)
Destroy target land. If you paid the kicker cost, destroy another target land.

cards.name: Dwarven Patrol
cards.text:
Dwarven Patrol doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever you cast a nonred spell, untap Dwarven Patrol.
cards.flavor: Dwarves never worry about who watches their backs.

rulings.text: Remember that lands are not spells.

cards.originalText:
Dwarven Patrol doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever you play a nonred spell, untap Dwarven Patrol.
